Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Misatapng to minanam, micomoday to ko singsi, sowalsa ko hanciw; katomireng! mita’ong!
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”
我今天七點到學校。: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Sata’angay hahanay niyam ko ngiha nga’ay ho singsi.""
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”
我今天七點到學校。: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Minanam i, pakafana’en no singsi kita to sa’osi no ’Amis.
In class, the teacher taught us the ’Amis language of numbers.
我今天七點到學校。: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: toolen niyam ko singsi misa’osi, romadiw kami to sa’osi a radiw.
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Adihayay ko ninanaman no mako a sowal to no ’Amis.
I have learned many ’Amis languages.
我今天七點到學校。: 我學會好多族語。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Malingad kako to romi’ami’ad a mitilid, minanam kako to romi’ami’ad to sowal no ’Amis, o papatengilen ko wina to pisano ’Amis ako.
I go to school every day, I learn the ’Amis language every day, and I want to tell my mother.
我今天七點到學校。: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: CiKacaw ko ngangan ako.
My name is kacaw.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的名字是Kacaw。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: CiPiya’ ko ngangan no wama ako.
My dad’s name is Piya.
我今天七點到學校。: 我爸爸的名字是Piya。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: CiHongay ko ngangan no wina ako.
My mother’s name is Hongay.
我今天七點到學校。: 我媽媽的名字是Hongay。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Moetep ko mihecaan ako.
I am 10 years old.
我今天七點到學校。: 我今年10歲。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Ira ko cecay a kaka ako to fa’inayan, ciKolas ko ngangan nira moetep ira ko cecay ko mihecaan nira.
I have a brother, his name is kolas, he is 11 years old.
我今天七點到學校。: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Kolas他今年11歲。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Mahecad ko pitilidan niyam a kongkoan.
We study in the same school.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們在同一間學校讀書。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Maolah romadiw’ kako ato kaka to fa’inayan.
Both my brother and I like to sing.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Maolah midangoy kako, pahanhan to i, malacafay midangoy ko paro no loma’ niyam.
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.
我今天七點到學校。: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Molah misafaeloh a ciwidang kako, malacafay romadiw ato midangoy kami.
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.
我今天七點到學校。: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: O wawa no ’Amis kako.
I am an ’Amis child.
我今天七點到學校。: 我是阿美族的小孩。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: I Posong ko loma’ niyam.
Our family lives in Posong.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們家住在台東。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Lalima ko tamdaw no loma’ niyam.
There are five people in our family.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們家共有五個人。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Tatoloay kami a malikaka.
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Malacafay ko aro’ ako ato wama, wina, kaka to fa’inayan ato kaka to fafahiyan.
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.
我今天七點到學校。: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: ’Akawangay ko wama ako, o Imeng cingra.
My father is tall and he is a policeman.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的爸爸很高，他是警察。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Mangiliway ko wina ako, o ising cingra.
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的媽媽很瘦，她是醫生。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: I loma’ ko wama ako misano ’Amis a caciyaw tamiyanan.
My father speaks the ’Amis language with us at home.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: O kafaedetan a pahanhanan minokayay tayra i niyaro’ kami.
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們暑假都會回部落。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Malacafayay kami a tatolo mitepa’ to takola’.
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和兄姊三人一起抓青蛙。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Maolahay kako to paro no loma’ niyam.
I like our family very much.
我今天七點到學校。: 我很喜歡我們家的人。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Malacafay kako ato Ina misalama anini.
I went out with my mother today.
我今天七點到學校。: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Salangdaw sanay ko kakarayan to romi’ad, cowa ka sienaw anca cowa kafaedet ko romi’ad, saemer ko fali.
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.
我今天七點到學校。: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: I rengorengosan komaen to miyen-paw kami tadadiheko a mapacidal ko tireng.
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Helek no lahok, mafalic to a kahengang ko kakarayan.
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.
我今天七點到學校。: 下午，天空變紅了。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Licay han no mako ciIna, mana kahengang ko kakarayan.
I asked my mother why the sky is red.
我今天七點到學校。: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Sowal sa ciIna, wa ira ko faliyos tayni alatek.
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.
我今天七點到學校。: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: O kakarayan to dadaya awaay ko ’o’ol, cowa kahadak ko fu’is.
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.
我今天七點到學校。: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Minokay to kita.
We were going home too.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們也要回家了。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Toya pinokayan a lalan, mitolon kako to fu’is.
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,
我今天七點到學校。: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願，

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Nanay awa a tayni ko faliyos, manga’ay a mahadak misalam kako.
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.
我今天七點到學校。: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Itatihiay no kongkoan ko loma’ ako, rakat sanay kako to romi’ami’ad, rakat sanay a minokay.
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Cowa kata’angay ko kongkoan niyam, cakahakowa ko mitiliday, mafana’ a madadama kami.
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Masa’op i ontofa ko kaemangay, malacafay a mimali, malacafay a mahaholol.
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.
我今天七點到學校。: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Kami ato singsi malacafay a misalama, o kongkoan mahecad to laloma’an niyam.
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.
我今天七點到學校。: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，我們學校是個大家庭。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Romi’ami’ad miasik kami, o rawang ma’olacay no polong a miasik.
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Roma tamdaw misisit to tanameng roma tamadaw miasik.
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.
我今天七點到學校。: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Miasik haca kami to kalotadimocokan no kongkoan, makomod ko polong to tatayalen, masolinga’ a ma’olac ko kongkoan.
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Inacila, tayra kako iniyaro’ miliso’ ciakongan.
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Halafin to caka saso’araw kami, ma’ilol to kako cingraan.
We haven't seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Ma’araw ni akong kako, pakaen takowanan to kacawas, pananomen ho kako to ociya.
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.
我今天七點到學校。: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，又請我喝茶。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: O nipalomaan niakong a kacawas koesanay.
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.
我今天七點到學校。: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Maolaha kako to ociya niakong, nga’ayay nanomen.
I also like grandpa's tea, it's tasted good too.
我今天七點到學校。: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: To kalahokan to i, malacafay kako cifofoan a mitangtang to salahok.
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.
我今天七點到學校。: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Kadofah ko nitangtangan nifofo a salahok, ira ko futing, koko’, ciyak, ato comoli.
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.
我今天七點到學校。: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、雞、南瓜、還有蝸牛。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Mahalek malahok, tayra kami i padatengan midateng.
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.
我今天七點到學校。: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Adihay ko nialaan nifofo a konga, pafeli takowanan to tali ato lokyok, hawikiden no mako a panokay.
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.
我今天七點到學校。: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: O maminokay to kami, liyaw a romi’ad tayra sato miliso’ cangraan.
I said goodbye to them and said I'd see them next time.
我今天七點到學校。: 我跟他們道別，改天再去拜訪他們。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Keliden no singsi kami tayra i pinanowangan, misarayaray i ka’ayaw no fawahan to mami’aca kami to paya.
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.
我今天七點到學校。: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Micomod i pinanowangan i, sowal sa ko singsi; ora ika’ayaway i. o ’aya’ayaman
kaikol i
我今天七點到學校。: o ’one’onelan
column5: After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back
column6: so you can visit them yourself.""
column7: 進入動物園後，老師說:「前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。」

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Matalaway kako to ’oner, mansa cowa pinengneng kako to ’one’onelan.
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.
我今天七點到學校。: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Adihay ko ’ayam to ma’araway no mako, ira i kilang cangra a miaefer, ma’araw haca ko ekong i ofang no kilang a mafoti’.
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.
我今天七點到學校。: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: I pinanowangan ira ko eco, efa ato lokedaw, i tiya ho cowa paka’araw kako to pinanowang, ma:hemek paka’araw anini.
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.
我今天七點到學校。: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Adihayay ko misasingan no mako, sapipanengneng ciamaan ato ciinaan.
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.
我今天七點到學校。: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Liyaw to a romi’ad toolen no mako ciama ato ciina malacafay a tayra.
Next time I will come with my parents.
我今天七點到學校。: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起去。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Tona pahanhanan, tayra i Posong miliso’ cifakian kako ato kaka to fafahiyan.
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.
我今天七點到學校。: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Nai Taypak mikalic to kasoling a tayra i Posong kami.
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Tahira i Posong, parakatay cifaki to paliding a militemoh tamiyanan.
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.
我今天七點到學校。: 到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: I ngataay no ciyataw ko loma’ nifaki, parakat to paliding caho caho tahira to.
The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.
我今天七點到學校。: 叔叔家就在車站附近，開車一下子就到了。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Ira ko ta’angayay a pipakaenan i ngata no loma’ nifaki, citingsa kami matatoor tayra i pipakaenan.
There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.
我今天七點到學校。: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: I pipakaenan, keriden nifaki pariri’ to siri ato mikalic to efa kami.
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.
我今天七點到學校。: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Dadaya, malahakelong tayra i maci a malafi kami.
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.
我今天七點到學校。: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃晚餐。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Adihayay ko paliding i maci, mansa pakaotopay tayra kami.
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.
我今天七點到學校。: 街上車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Ya mamiliyas i, faheka matakaway ko otopay, saka mikalic to paso kami.
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.
我今天七點到學校。: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Minokay to kami tayra i Taypak, haiken maxeraay to nifaki koya matakaway a otopay hakiya!
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.
我今天七點到學校。: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有!

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: I sikano ko loma’ niyam, i kaemang ho, namitilid to, palinah tayra i takaw, itira sato ko ’orip i tokay.
When we were young, our family lived in sikano. After I started school, we moved to Kaohsiung and have been living in the city ever since.
我今天七點到學校。: 小時候我們家住在鹿野，上學以後，就搬到了高雄，一直在都市裡生活。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Na mitilid to iTasiye, patodong sanay kako a minanam to pakayniay i serangawan no Yin-co-min, cipinangay to a mafana’ to makahirahiraay a serangawn no Yin-co-min-co i Taywan.
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.
我今天七點到學校。: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Saka, anini mihecaan o pahanhanan to no kafaedetan i, minokay tayra i niyaro’ miliso’ to malitengay kako ato kaka to fa’inayan, hay mafana’ to niyah a finacadana ato serangawan.
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.
我今天七點到學校。: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Falo polo’ to ko mihecaan noya malitengay, kawrira, nengneng han mato tahatenokay ho ko mihecaan nira.
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.
我今天七點到學校。: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來他的年齡好像中年人。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Licay han no mako cingra ono icowacowaay ko kafana’an iso a sowal, calicpic ko sowal nira to no ’Amis, mafana’ haca to sowal no Ponong, Ngayngay ato no Dipong a sowal.
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in ’Amis, as well as Bunun, Hakka and Japanese.
我今天七點到學校。: 我問他你會哪些語言，他的阿美語說得很流利，也會說布農語、客家語和日本話。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Nalicayen fana’ sato kako, hanaw o nano kaemangan ho cingra minanamay to sowal no Dipong, o Ponong ko fafahi, i katayalan nira adihay ko kananaman a Ngayngay, mansa kahirahira ko kafana’an nira to sowal.
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Bunun, and he knows many Hakkas at work, so he can speak so many languages.
我今天七點到學校。: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是布農族人，而他工作上認識許多客家人，所以他會說這麼多語言。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Ya milicay kami i, sowal sa to maamaan to pakayniay mi’adopay a pinangan no litengan ato taneng.
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Ano awa awa ko kafana’an niyam mitengil i, kawrira, o tingwa ko sapiluing niyam, ta nga’ay kami miliyaw a mitengil.
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.
我今天七點到學校。: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Awaay ko kafanafana’an no mako to niyah a serangawn ato finacadan, pakayni takowanan mangodo kako a miharateng.
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.
我今天七點到學校。: 小時候我不瞭解自己的族群和文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Matongalmatongal to ko fana’ i, na o ’Aims ko tireng, o tadamasaromaay to, o kanono’an to a malita’ang.
The more I know, the more I feel that being a ’Aims is unique and something to be proud of.
我今天七點到學校。: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為阿美族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: I kalafian anini, o maminokay ko safa to fa’inayan.
My younger brother is going home this evening.
我今天七點到學校。: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Tayra i icifa mi’aca to koko’ ci fofo ato kako, misaday to sakalafi no safa to fa’inayan.
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Mita’elif kami to pi’acaan to dateng, adihay ko faelohay a dateng noya pa’aca’ay.
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Mi’aca to kami to incay, koreto ato saytaw.
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Oya pi’acaan to losay a tawki sowal sa, “koesanay ko onglay ato lopas ako, mi’aca to miming makenaay saw!”
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”
我今天七點到學校。: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Mi’aca to kami itiya to onglay ato lopas.
We bought pineapples and peaches.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Mita’elif to kami toya pi’acaan to koko’, sowal sa koya tawki, “O maan ko ’a’acaen iso? ta’angay a masoeso ko koko’ anini, tolo so’ot ko cecay a kakoko’an.”
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”
我今天七點到學校。: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: ’Atekaken cifofo, sakaemeden ko ’aca mamanay han nira ko tawki a milicay.
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.
我今天七點到學校。: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: O sakaemeday to ko ’aca saan ko sowal no tawki, cowa to ko nganga’ay a lowanen.
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.
我今天七點到學校。: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Oya tatihiay a tawki sowal sa, katayni mi’aca to futing ako, kaemeday a ta’angay ko futing no mako.
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.
我今天七點到學校。: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Ikol to, o koko’ o futing ko ma’acaay niyam, tahaloma’ tangtangen tomes sa ko dateng i eto.
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.
我今天七點到學校。: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子滿滿的菜。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Halafin to ko pitatala, to’eman sato ko romi’ad.
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.
我今天七點到學校。: 等了好久，天已經黑了。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Toya pitatalaan, ira ko tingwa no safa to fa’inayan sowal sa, malipalaw ira ko latoh no kalasofitayan, cowa kanga’ay pasera’ ko sofitay sa. Liyaw hanto no pa’aliwacan a minokay.
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.
我今天七點到學校。: 在等待中，弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Sowal sa ci fofo adihay ko mitangtangan pohayen ko salawinawina malacafay a komaen!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!
我今天七點到學校。: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫親戚一起來吃吧!

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Tahidangen to niyam ko salawinawina ato widawidang, malacafay a komaen tona sakadofah sanay a sakalafi.
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Ira ko cecay a kapot ako, ci Kacaw ko ngangan nira.
I have a classmate named Kacaw, he often forgets to bring things.
我今天七點到學校。: 我有一個同學叫Kacaw，他常常忘記帶東西。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Ano mitilid i, micaliw cingra to impic no kapot, sasipasip ato pitilidan.
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.
我今天七點到學校。: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Kinacecay, kinatosa, kinatolo, pacaliwan no polong to manmaan cingra
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.
我今天七點到學校。: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Kawrira manamnam to ko pinangan nira i, cowa to patikol to nicaliwan a manmaan.
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.
我今天七點到學校。: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Ikol to, awaay to ko makahiay pacaliwa to manmaan cingraan.
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.
我今天七點到學校。: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Ira ko cecay a romi’ad, mapolong kami tayra i pala misalama.
One day, we all went on an outing together.
我今天七點到學校。: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Ifatad no lalan, tatayra i tata’ian ci Kacaw, kawra matawal ningra ko silikami.
On the way, Kacaw wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.
我今天七點到學校。: 路途中，Kacaw想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Micalw to silikami no kapot cingra kawrira paca’of han no polong cingra, away ko mahawikiday no mako yo.
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn't bring them either.
我今天七點到學校。: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Tomangic ci Kacaw to rawraw aca, keter sa a somowal, mana capacaliwen namo kako to silikami!
Kacaw burst into tears. He said angrily, why don't everyone lend me toilet paper!
我今天七點到學校。: Kacaw急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼你們都不借我衛生紙!!

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Sowal han no kapot cingra, nawhani nacowa pihawikid kiso, roma sato pacaliwen kiso to manmaan, cowa patikol!
The classmate told him, because you didn't bring it yourself, and you wouldn't return the things lent to you!
我今天七點到學校。: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Tocila a romi’ad malingad mitilid, pacerem ciKacaw tayra i kongkoan, oya nicaliwan niKacaw a manmaan no kapot patikolen to nira ko kapot.
The next day at school, Kacaw arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.
我今天七點到學校。: 隔天上學，Kacaw很早就到學校了，Kacaw把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Kangodoan to kamo han ni Kacaw ko kapot, ikol to mihawikid to kako to manmaan sa, ahowiday kapot i’ayaw nipacaliw kamo takowanan to manmaan makahi kako a pacaliw tamowanan.
kacaw apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.
我今天七點到學校。: Kacaw向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: O mi’adopay a tamdaw i niyaro’ ko wama ako.
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: I kaemang ho kako, o dadaya ho mahadak to ci ama ato ci faki, mihawikid to fonos ato kowang.
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.
我今天七點到學校。: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Tadengal ko romi’ad, hawikiden to nangra a panokay ko tama’.
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵物回來。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Latek o fafoy, anca o lawal, roma i, latek iraay ko torok.
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.
我今天七點到學校。: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: I sacomod no niyaro’ malalilam cangra to tama’ a pafatis to finawlan.
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Liyangen to ako ci ama to romi’ami’ad, to sapi’ociraw aca ciamaan a mi’adop.
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.
我今天七點到學校。: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Sowal sa ci ama, ta’angay to kako nga’ itiya sato mikelid cingra takowanan a malingad.
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: O talakal ko sapilamec to tama’ ko fa’inayan no niyaro’, misanga’ cangra to wa’il a talakal ato fakeloh a talakal.
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.
我今天七點到學校。: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Mafana’ay a misanga’ to wa’il a talakal ci ama ako, sowal sa ci ama, “o sapitalakal to torok koni, solinga’en no mita a minengneng ko narakatan a saripa’ no ’a’adopen, itiraen ko talakal a miteli i karomakatan no ’a’adopen.”
My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: To romi’ami’ad a minanam kako misanga’ to talakal, sakikahenay a mihakelong to malitengay a mi’adop, ’araw han kahenayay citama’ koya talakal no mako.
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Ma’araw niama ako sowal sa, “ikol to o tadamaanay to kiso a mi’adopay a tamdaw.”
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸看到後對我說：「你以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。」

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Ta’angayay to kako no hatini, mikoyod kako to pana’ ato ’idoc, mihakelong ciamaan a mi’adop.
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.
我今天七點到學校。: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Minokay to tahira i niyaro’ i, pafatisen to ako ko fanawlan to tama’ ako.
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 回到部落時，我將獵物和族人們分享。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Sowal sa ci ama, “miahowiday kita to sapalemed no liteng, milongoc to sapakadofah no mita to tama’.”
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Maapacay kako talapitakcian to papacem.
I was late for school this morning.
我今天七點到學校。: 我早上上學遲到了。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Tayra i pitakcian haw i, matawalay ako ko kacikafang.
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.
我今天七點到學校。: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Awaay ko maanmaan a mihawikidan ako.
I didn't bring anything with me.
我今天七點到學校。: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Minanam to i, malacecay minengneng to tilid kako ato kapot.
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.
我今天七點到學校。: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Misekin to i, pacaliwen no kapot kako to impic ato sasipasip.
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.
我今天七點到學校。: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Sowal sato ko singsi i takowanan “miliyaw to malatal a lomowad, aka to kaapac!”
The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""
我今天七點到學校。: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Ci Kacaw han ko sanga’ayay a widang ako, O wawa no ’Amis cingra.
My good friend's name is Kacaw, and he is also an Amis child.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的好朋友叫Kacaw，他也是阿美族的小孩。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Malacafay kami a mitakeci i Fanaw a niyaro’.
We study together in the Tafalong tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們一起在池上部落讀書。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Mararid kami malacafay mitengil to pakongko no malitengay, saheto mafana’ay kami a misano’Amsi.
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Amis proficiently.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說阿美語。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: ’Akawang a maso^:so kako, poener a mangiliw ci Kacaw.
I am tall and overweight, while Kacaw is short and thin.
我今天七點到學校。: 我很高也很胖，Kacaw很矮也很瘦。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Tariktikay ci Kacaw, o kaolaolahan no ’alomanay cingra.
Kacaw is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.
我今天七點到學校。: Kacaw很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: O piontokayan no pitakcian anini, adihay ko lalifetan to mipatirengan no pitakcian.
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.
我今天七點到學校。: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Ira ko matatengteng to saso’ot, mitenok to mali, comikayay, misakeroay, mipana’ay.
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
我今天七點到學校。: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Milifet kako to comikayay.
I participated in the running competition.
我今天七點到學校。: 我比賽跑步。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Toya kacomikay ako haw i, mapolin kako, adihay ko ’ilang nai toros no mako.
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.
我今天七點到學校。: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Nikaorira lomowad kako, milingato a pasi’ayaw a comikay.
But I stood up and continued running forward.
我今天七點到學校。: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Tangasa to kako i pipatosokan mahemek ko ’alomanay.
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.
我今天七點到學校。: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Mahaenhaen caka pakaala to sakacecay, nikaorira mahemekay kako, Hay o malaheciay to ko lalalifeten ako.
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.
我今天七點到學校。: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: I nacila, miliso’ay kako ato wama to faki ako.
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.
我今天七點到學校。: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Madoka’ay ko oo’ no faki.
My uncle injured his foot.
我今天七點到學校。: 叔叔的腳受傷了。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Pasowal cingra i tamiyanan, maofangay ko fadahong no loma’.
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.
我今天七點到學校。: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Oya misanga’ cingra to fadahong i, matefaday nanifadahong.
He fell off the roof while repairing it.
我今天七點到學校。: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Paterongen no wama ci faki to titi no kolong ato ’icep.
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Malalicalicay kako ato faki i kafoti’an i, adihay ko mipainian ningra a kongko.
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Yo mamiliyas kako to ’ayaw i, mipahemek ko faki i takowanan to “’aka:wang to a tanes:tes to kiso” saan.
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.
我今天七點到學校。: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Pacaof han ako, “Ano ma’adah to ko oo’ no faki i, katay ho i loma’ niyam a mihalama.”
I said, When your foot gets better
我今天七點到學校。: come to our house next time and visit us.""
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34189/5: 我說：「等叔叔腳好了，下次也來我們家玩。」

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: I tosa ca’ol tosa polo’ ira ko tosa a mihecaan, mitahidang ko seyfo to pakayni i manga’ay deng ono finacadang a ngangan matilid i nifonsiw no Yencomin a kayki.
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.
我今天七點到學校。: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Mihomong kako to halafinay a milongc to seyfo to pipakafit to ngangan no Yencomin i nifonsiw a kapah no niyaro’ ci Namoh Tongso’.
I interviewed Namoh Tongso’, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.
我今天七點到學校。: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Namoh Tongso’。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Matatelek kako ato cingra tona pa’aliwacan tayra i loma’ ningra a mihomong cingranan.
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Toya pihomongan i, siwkayen ningra kako to sakaira no ngangan ningra, mipakafana’ haca to laloma’an ningra, niyaro’ ningra.
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Licayen ako cingra, mana padeteng sa mifalic to ngangan, ya telang a mitingkian a ngangan, cowa kanga’ay haw?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?
我今天七點到學校。: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Sowal sa cingra i takowanan, cowa kamo^ecel ko tilid no Kowaping to todong no ngangan nira. Anca i, “Na-siyen-sen” hananay no tao cingra, saka, adihay ko sakatawaan nona ngangan.
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Na Xian Sheng
我今天七點到學校。: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34189/5: 他對我說，因為用中文字並不能準確的傳達他的名字，其他人還會叫他「那先生」，也因此鬧出不少笑話。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Sowal sa ci Namoh, “O no Yencomin ko mitilidan a ngangan nga, o tadatatodongay a ngangan kitaanan. O sakatatodong no finacadan ita, laloma’an ita, tireng ita ko ngangan ako. Saka, nanay ’aloman ko mitikol to niyah a ngangan.”
Namoh Tongso’ said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group
我今天七點到學校。: our family
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34189/5: our identity. I hope more fellow tribespeople can reclaim their own names.\""
column5: Namoh說：「原住民語書寫的名字才是我們真正的名字。我的名字代表了我們的族群、我們的家族、我們的身分，希望能有更多族人找回自己的名字。」

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: I nacila malacafay kako ato fofo tayra i icifa a paliwal. Adihay ko mi’olongan ni fofo to mipalomaan ningra a dateng, mitangtang haca cingra tono Yincominay a kakaenen to sapakaen to ’alomanay.
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.
我今天七點到學校。: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: ’Alomanay ko maolahay to nipaliwalan ni fofo a dateng. ’Alomanay ko mi’acaay to kamamoday ato tayalin. ’Aloman ko komaenay to mitangtangan ningra a dateng.
Everyone loved my grandmother's stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.
我今天七點到學校。: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和車輪茄很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Tadaka^so’ koya nitangtangan ningra a paheko ato hakhak. Ira ho ko mitengelan to titi no fafoy a makaw-loro. Oya kafangsis mapasolot to ko ’alomanay. Taynitayni sato ko ’alomanay a misarayaray a mi’aca.
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.
我今天七點到學校。: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的馬告滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Oya mitantang ho ko fofo i, miannay kako to lafang. Sata’angay sa ko pi’a’iyoy ako, “Saheto o no niyah a mipalomaan, cowa kapaiyoen, halikien a tayni mi’aca yo!”
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, The vegetables are self-grown
我今天七點到學校。: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!""
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34189/5: 奶奶煮東西的時候，我在旁邊招攬客人。我在一旁大喊著：「蔬菜都是自己種的，天然有機，趕快來買喔!」

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Kalikiay a mapaliwal ko dateng niyam. Sowal sa ci fofo, “Hay, iraay kiso a mipacafay kira”
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, It's all thanks to your help.""
我今天七點到學校。: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Pakayni toni a demakan, mafana’ to kako to pakayni i dateng no Yencomin ato kalofana’ no kakaenen, matinako haca ko roray no mipaliwalay.
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.
我今天七點到學校。: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to ikongkoan kako: Ma’araw ko fofo to nikaolah tono litengan a dateng, Tada malita’ang ato maremed kako.
Seeing my grandmother's passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
我今天七點到學校。: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
